org.objectfabric

Class Headers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.objectfabric.Headers

  • public class Headers
extends java.lang.Object
    Common representation of connection headers. If a transport does not supports headers natively, e.g. sockets, or response headers in case of WebSocket, OF will serialize them internally. Keeps ordering and allows multiple values per key as required by HTTP.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the header value with the specified header name. If there are more than one header value for the specified header name, the first value is returned.

      • getMultiple

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMultiple(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the header values with the specified header name.

      • getAsList

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getAsList()
        Returns all header names and values.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true if and only if there is a header with the specified header name.

      • getNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getNames()
        Returns the set of all header names.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String name,
       java.lang.String value)
        Adds a new header with the specified name and value.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String name,
       java.lang.String value)
        Sets a new header with the specified name and value. If there is an existing header with the same name, the existing header is removed.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String name,
       java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> values)
        Sets a new header with the specified name and values. If there is an existing header with the same name, the existing header is removed.

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(java.lang.String name)
        Removes the header with the specified name.

      • clearHeaders

        public void clearHeaders()
        Removes all headers.
